bug.short_desc: Allow for a port auto-selection of the source-server

long_desc.thetext:
Currently, the port for a source-server instance is pre-configured (as 8080). If the user starts the source-server of another app, there would be a conflict. As this is not an untypical scenario, this should be facilitated without having the user to adapt the apps' config.json files.
A possible solution as discussed with Thomas could be that the source-server started by trying port 8080 and if unsuccessful would go on until a free port is found (or an upper limit of tries is reached, respectively). Configuration should be simple, e.g. an add'tl config key for the number of ports to try (starting with the port configured).
This could be made the default for skeletons. Obviously, looking for the next free port should be disallowed for an app that already has a running source-server.

Letting OS determine a free port.
